title: Sri Lanka pays US$38mn for two coal ships: Minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka has paid 38 million US dollars for two ships, Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekera said allowing coal for power generation during a monsoon season to be unloaded.
“Two vessels carrying 120,000 MT of Coal begun unloading after the payment of US$ 38 million,” Minister Wijesekera sid.
“With these two vessels the Coal requirement before the monsoon deadline is fulfilled.”
The South West monsoon starts in May when coal cannot be unloaded through barges due to choppy seas. Coal can next be imported around September.

Energy sector had warned that coal for three plants would run out by August, and one plant 300Mega Watt plant would have to be shut from May to allow at least two plants to continue over September until coal could be imported.
Minister Wijesekera said jet fuel cargo and a diesel ship had started unloading as well.
Sri Lanka is facing severe forex shortages due to a so-called ‘flexible exchange rate’ with anchor conflicts which had not been changed to a single anchor regime for 72 years. (Colombo/April20/2022)
